page.title: 10 FARMING AROUND KENNINGTON
page.content: The main type of farming in the{KEN- {NINGTON}area is arable; usually wheat, oats, rape and barley. Grass for hay and grazing is also grown. Horti- culture, farming of vegetables, is not very common in the area, and fields of horticultural crop are in the minority. There are five farms in{ {KENNINGTON: EASTWELL COURT, LENACRE {FARM, TOWER FARM, SANDYHURST FARM} and{PARKBARN FARM.}At Eastwell Court mainly arable crops are grown. Ducks are bred at the duck farm for their meat and eggs. Sandyhurst Farm grows arable crops and also breeds cows and sheep. Tower farm and Parkbarn Farm both produce arable crops. Of course not all non-residential land in the { {KENNINGTON}area is arable, about a quarter of it is woodland although it is rapidly decreasing because much is being cut down for reidential purposes
